histore.document.json.reader module¶

Reader for lists of objects that are maintained as a serialized Json array in a file on the file system.

class histore.document.json.reader.JsonIterator(filename: str, compression: Optional[str] = None, decoder: Optional[Callable] = None)¶

Bases: histore.document.base.DocumentIterator

Document iterator for documents that have been serialized as Json documents. The iterator expects a file that contains a list if lists (rows). The first row is expected to contain the document schema. Data rows are expected to be triples of row position, row index, and cell values.

close()¶

Close the associated Json reader.

has_next() → bool¶

Test if the iterator has more rows to read.

Returns

Return type

bool

next() → Tuple[int, Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime, Tuple[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime], …]], List[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime]]]¶

Read the next row in the document.

Returns the row position, row index and the list of cell values for each of the document columns. Raises a StopIteration error if an attempt is made to read past the end of the document.

Returns

Return type

tuple of int, histore.document.base.RowIndex, histore.document.base.DataRow

class histore.document.json.reader.JsonReader(filename: str, compression: Optional[str] = None, decoder: Optional[Callable] = None)¶

Bases: object

Abstract reader for rows in a Json file. Returns rows that are Json objects. The reader is agnostice to the format of these rows. The format is implementation dependent and different sub-classes will implement their own deserialization function.

close()¶

Release all reseources that are associated with the reader.

has_next() → bool¶

The next row for the reader is the current buffer value.

If the buffer is empty the end of the file has been reached.

Returns

Return type

bool

histore.document.json.reader.default_decoder(obj: Dict) → Any¶

Default Json object decoder. Accounts for date types that have been encoded as dictionaries.

Parameters

obj (dict) – Json object that is being encountered by the Json reader.

Returns

Return type

any
